t: Brand Colors
s: The Alexa brand’s primary color is Alexa Blue.

t: Amazon Colors - Hex, RGB, CMYK, Pantone | Color Codes - U.S. Brand Colors
s: The official Amazon colors are Amazon Orange and black. We recommend using the Amazon color palette for personal projects and in the case of commercial use to visit the company website.

t: Amazon Brand Registry | Sell on Amazon
s: Enroll your brand in Amazon Brand Registry to unlock tools designed to protect and build your brand, creating a better experience for your Amazon customers.

t: Amazon brand color hex codes - BrandColors
s: It's been featured by Smashing Magazine, CSS-Tricks, Web Design Depot, Tuts+, and over 2 million pageviews. There are now over 600 brands with 1600 colors and the collection is always growing.

t: Amazon Brand Registry: Protect your brand in Italy
s: Start your brand's Amazon journey by enrolling it in Amazon Brand Registry for free. After enrolling, you'll be able to unlock a suite of brand-building tools and obtain various protection benefits. You can enrol your brand even if you don't sell in an Amazon store.

t: Amazon Logo Colors - Brands and Logos - SchemeColor.com
s: There are 2 colors in Amazon Logo - Vivid Gamboge (#FF9900) and Black (#000000). The RGB and CMYK values of the colors are in the table below along with the closest RAL and PANTONE® numbers.

t: VFAUOSIT Brand Kitchen Faucets Recalled Due to Dangerous Lead Exposure for Young Children; Sold on Amazon.com by Whisper08 | CPSC.gov
s: Consumers should immediately stop using these faucets and contact Whisper08 about disposal and a refund. Consumers will need to provide a photograph of disposal and their order number to receive the refund. Whisper08 is contacting all known purchasers directly.Until these faucets can be replaced, ...

t: Amazon Color Palette | HEX, RGB & HSL
s: July 23, 2021 - Amazon's color palette primarily consists of colors orange and black. The hex values for those colors are #FF9900 and #000000 respectively.

t: Amazon (company) - Wikipedia
s: 3 days ago - Amazon sells many products under its own brand names, including phone chargers, batteries, and diaper wipes. The AmazonBasics brand was introduced in 2009, and now features hundreds of product lines, including smartphone cases, computer mice, batteries, dumbbells, and dog crates.
